answerText: Grimm[10] Grimm's law describes the transition of voiceless stops into voiceless varieties of these consonants, which are produced by placing two articulators close together. Examples of these consonants from English include the sounds produced by the letters v and f.
heading: Penn Bowl |2014 | 11 | 12 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: A man with this surname examined the mythology of the early Teutons in German Mythology. For 10 points each: [10] Give this surname of Jacob, who described a process of consonant shifts in Germanic languages in his namesake law, and who also created a notable compilation of fairy tales with his brother Wilhelm.
